org.activebpel.rt.bpeladmin.war.graph.bpel
Class AeGridTable

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpeladmin.war.graph.bpel.AeGridTable
public class AeGridTable
extends java.lang.Object

Grid to hold BPEL objects while performing the auto layout.

Method Detail

addGridElement

public boolean addGridElement(AeBpelControllerBase aNode,
                              java.util.List aParents,
                              int aRow,
                              int aCol)
Adds an element to the grid table. Returns a status indicating if the element was added successfully. An add will fail if a component already exists at the desired location. The input params aRow or aCol may be set to -1 to indicated auto insert mode, but at least one must be set to a non negative number.

Parameters:
aNode - the node element we are adding
aParents - a list of the parent nodes for this element
aRow - the row we would like to be added to (-1 for auto append)
aCol - the column we would like to be added to (-1 for auto append)
Returns:
boolean status indicator (true = success, false = failure)

removeGridElement

public void removeGridElement(int aRow,
                              int aCol)
Removes an element from the grid table at the specified location.

Parameters:
aRow - the row we are looking for
aCol - the column we are looking for

getNextColumnForRow

public int getNextColumnForRow(int aRow)
Finds the next available slot for a given row.

Parameters:
aRow - the row we are interested in
Returns:
the next available slot.

getNextRowForColumn

public int getNextRowForColumn(int aCol)
Finds the next available slot for a given column.

Parameters:
aCol - the column we are interested in
Returns:
the next available slot.

getGridElement

public AeGridElement getGridElement(int aRow,
                                    int aCol)
Finds the grid element we are looking for given the row and column.

Parameters:
aRow - the row we are looking for
aCol - the column we are looking for
Returns:
AeGridElement object if found, null otherwise.

public AeGridElement findGridElement(AeBpelControllerBase aNode)

Returns:
AeGridElement object if found, null otherwise.

public AeGridElement findGridElement(AeBpelObjectBase aNode)
Finds the grid element for the given node model or returns null if not found.

Parameters:
aNode - the node model we are looking for
Returns:
AeGridElement object if found, null otherwise.

adjustLayout

public void adjustLayout()
Once all grid elements have been placed in the table, this routine will adjust the grid element locations. The objective is to first position the child elements next to one another. Next we will attempt to center the parent above the children.

centerRowElements

private int centerRowElements(int aRowLevel,
                              int aMaxCols)
Used to center parents of a sibling group for a given row.

Parameters:
aRowLevel - the current row level we are processing
aMaxCols - the maximum columns in the grid
Returns:
maximum columns in the grid, which may change if elements are added

centerElementRange

private int centerElementRange(AeGridElement aFirst,
                               AeGridElement aLast,
                               int aMaxCols)
Used to center the parent of a group of elements within the major axis. If the group range represents a single element, then the element will be centered beneath it's parent. Otherwise the parent is centered above the element group.

Parameters:
aFirst - the first element in the range
aLast - the last element in the range (may be same as first)
aMaxCols - maximum number of columns in grid
Returns:
number of columns in the grid, which may have changed.

shiftRowData

private int shiftRowData(AeGridElement aElement,
                         int aTgtCol,
                         int aMaxCols)
Given a grid element and the new target column, this method will shift the remaining columns within a row to the right. The width of the row is returned in case this operation affects the row width.

Parameters:
aElement - the grid element to be shifted
aTgtCol - the target column the grid element will be shifted to
aMaxCols - the maximum column width of the grid
Returns:
the width of the grid, which may have been modified

getCommonParent

private AeBpelObjectBase getCommonParent(AeGridElement aGridA,
                                         AeGridElement aGridB)
Given two grid elements, returns the common parent if found.

Parameters:
aGridA - first element to compare
aGridB - second element to compare
Returns:
common parent if one was found

addToBucket

private void addToBucket(AeGridElement aElement)
Adds a grid element element to a bucket with common siblings. The bucket management is such that bucket 0 is reserved for root nodes, but all others are available for grouping. If we run out of buckets, the bucket array is resized to contain 50% more than before and a new bucket is started for the siblings.

Parameters:
aElement - the element to be added.

assignColumnsToBuckets

private void assignColumnsToBuckets()
Method to assign cell indices to the buckets of children we have gathered

emptyBuckets

private void emptyBuckets()
Method to empty out all buckets, so they may be used in next iteration.

repositionVertical

public java.awt.Dimension repositionVertical()
Once all grid elements have been placed in the table and the layout has been adjusted, this routine will assign new coordinates to the components based on their grid location. This layout is for a vertical orientation.

Returns:
the new size of the container

repositionHorizontal

public java.awt.Dimension repositionHorizontal()

getMaxCols

public int getMaxCols()
Obtains the maximum number of columns in our grid.

Returns:
representing the maximum number of columns in the grid

getMaxRows

public int getMaxRows()
Obtains the maximum number of rows in our grid.

Returns:
representing the maximum number of rows in the grid

getMaxRowHeight

public int getMaxRowHeight(int aRow)
Determine the maximum height of components in the given row.

Parameters:
aRow - the target row for the operation.
Returns:
the height of the component with the greatest height in pixels

Parameters:

Returns:

getMaxColWidth

public int getMaxColWidth(int aColumn)
Determine the maximum width for components in the given column.

Parameters:
aColumn - the target column for the operation.
Returns:
the width of the component with the largest size in pixels

getSimpleFigure

protected AeBpelSimpleActivityFigure getSimpleFigure(AeGridElement aGridElement)
Returns the figure if true the element passed is associated with a simple activities with icons and left or right text orientation. Otherwise returns null.

Parameters:
aGridElement -

isSimpleGrid

protected boolean isSimpleGrid()
Returns true if the grid data contains all simple figure as defined by getSimpleFigure.

getAnchorWidthDelta

protected int getAnchorWidthDelta(AeGridElement aGridElement)
If passed element is a simple figure as defined by getSimpleFigure then it returns the text width. for adjustment of the column width.

Parameters:
aGridElement -
Returns:
The width adjustment

getMaxColHeight

public int getMaxColHeight(int aColumn)
Determine the maximum height for components in the given column.

Parameters:
aColumn - the target column for the operation.
Returns:
the height of the component with the largest size in pixels

insertColumn

public void insertColumn(int aCol)
Insert a new column at the the specified location, shifting any existing columns to the right. The column locations are zero based, to shift over the first column specify aCol as 0.

Parameters:
aCol - the column position to insert from
